title: Would it be appropriate for Louis-Alphonse, Duke of Anjou to bear the Oriflamme into battle today if he were accompanying a non-French army? - Quora

response.answer_text: As I understand it, the Oriflamme is the King of France’s battle standard. The current Duke of Anjou is not the king of France, regardless of whether he thinks he is or popular opinion among French citizens and government. So it being present with him at all with any army is not relevant, it would be like me carrying the French flag at a NFL match: everyone would just think I’m a weirdo.

Erh… what would he be doing in a foreign army? And why would he carry the symbol of a political system that doesn’t exist anymore? There’s no king in France, it is a Republic with a President elected every five years.
